message_1: Suppose we have a stream of bits 1010110110 and the secret key is 1101. Apply the one-time pad technique using the XOR operation to encrypt the stream of bits. What is the resulting ciphertext?
message_2:
To apply the one-time pad technique using the XOR operation, we first need to extend the secret key to match the length of the stream of bits. The secret key is 1101, so we repeat it until it has the same length as the stream of bits: 110111011101.

Now, we perform the XOR operation between the stream of bits and the extended secret key:

1010110110
1101110111
----------
0111000001

So, the resulting ciphertext is 0111000001.
